body.name: SmallRig AD-01 Video Tripod, 73" Heavy Duty Tripod with 360 Degree Fluid Head and Quick Release Plate for DSLR, Camcorder, Cameras 3751
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 18 hrs 12 mins
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 18 hrs 12 mins
features: 【Dual-Mode Quick-Release Plate Mount】The fluid head is compatible with two modes of quick-release plates - Mode for DJI RS 2/RS3/RS3 PRO, and for Manfrotto. This dual-mode mount design allows you to switch between the two quick-release plate. Equip with quick release plate for Manfrotto(standard mode), fitted with 1/4"-20 screws and 3/8-16" screws, making the video head compatible with most cameras.

【Stable and Adjustable Tripod】Professional heavy duty aluminum double-tube tripod with built-in bubble level, high-strength aluminum alloy double-row tubes and 75mm bowl bottom, which can provide better stability for the video tripod. The adjustable height of the travel tripod is: 85-186cm/33-73in, and the maximum load is: 8KG/17LBS.

【Professional Fluid Head】Built-in damping and balancing system enable 360° horizontal and +90°/-60° vertical movements.The camera fluid head adopts side-pressed quick release, which can be unlocked by pushing the side button to realize the quick disassembly and installation of the camera.

【Portability and Storage Convenience】Featuring a spacious carrying handle on the tripod and an anti-slip design, this professional tripod ensures easy portability and comfortable transitions. Additionally, the quick release plate features a built-in wrench for convenient use. For easy storage, the tripod comes with a handbag equipped storage option.
【Package Includes】1 x heavy-duty fluid head tripod，1 x carrying bag, 1 x quick release plate for Manfrotto, 1 x 1/4''-20 screw, 1 x 3/8"-16 screw,1 x user manual.
body.description: SmallRig 73" Heavy Duty Tripod with 360 Degree Fluid Head and Quick Release Plate Key Features: Compatible with the quick release plate for RS 2 stabilizer; Feel free to switch the dual modes for DJI RS 2 and for ManfrottoHigh compatibility for quick disassembly and assembly (dedicated quick release plate for this item)Max.Payload: 17.64 lbs (8 kg)Non-slip large tripod carrying handle with optimized operation experience Adjustable Height: 85-186cm/33-73in Product Dimensions: 16x 16.5 x 89cm/6.3 x 6.5 x 35in Package Dimensions: 16x 17 x92cm/6.3 x 6.7 x 36.2in Net Weight: 4kg/8.8lbs Package Weight: 4.9kg/10.8lbs

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Details of SmallRig Heavy Duty Tripod Compatibility: Universal Pitching Angle: +90°/-60° Ball Base: 75 mm Material: Aluminum Alloy SmallRig 73" Heavy Duty Tripod with 360 Degree Fluid Head and Quick Release Plate Key Features: Compatible with the quick release plate for RS 2 stabilizer; Feel free to switch the dual modes for DJI RS 2 and for ManfrottoHigh compatibility for quick disassembly and assembly (dedicated quick release plate for this item)Max.Payload: 17.64 lbs (8 kg)Non-slip large tripod carrying handle with optimized operation experience Adjustable Height: 85-186cm/33-73in Product Dimensions: 16x 16.5 x 89cm/6.3 x 6.5 x 35in Package Dimensions: 16x 17 x92cm/6.3 x 6.7 x 36.2in Net Weight: 4kg/8.8lbs Package Weight: 4.9kg/10.8lbs

Expand Multiple Devices The 1/4"-20 threaded holes on the fluid head can help you expand various external devices, such as monitors, mobile phones, microphone, video light, etc. 75mm Bowl Base This video tripod has a built-in bubble level, which can be adjusted horizontally with a 75mm ball bowl, which is convenient for managing the horizontal line of the screen. Middle Spreader The mid-level sling is useful for increasing the stability of the tripod, which also provides stable support when working on uneven surfaces. Carry Bag The tripod comes with a special carry bag to better protect the tripod and make it easy to carry. Note: The accessories for the tripod are in the built-in side pocket of the carry bag.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great Value for the money, well built and easy to setup. Love the clamps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: this holds my sony camera perfectly and is very sturdy!!This helps me get that perfect shot.highly recommend this if you are needing a tripod

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Put a camera on it!
reviews.reviewText: You need a tripod. The tripod needs to be able to handle your camera. This can handle a lot of weight. The tilt adjustment adds a fair amount of friction and feels great. Pan adjustment is either locked or free movement with no friction, so it’ll be wild and takes a bit finesse and a light touch.I have used it for two gigs now with my c300mkii and it handles it well. It goes plenty tall and is nearly weightless in comparison to my old beast of a manfrotto tripod. A breath of fresh air really.So all in all it’s a great tripod at an insanely low price that is built well enough to live in my kit for decades.If you’re the type of filmmaker who thrashes gear to death then you may want something a bit more robust. But also you should sit down and meditate on why you treat your gear like it’s rented and you have a vendetta against the producers to the point where you are insistent on leaving them with a massive L&D bill at the end of the show. Why are you like this??? And then… buy this tripod and treat it like it deserves to be respected, as do all the pieces of gear in your kit.So in closing: great tripod, great price, treat it well and it will return the favor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's cheap and it's OK
reviews.reviewText: This is a cheap tripod, don't think it's more than that. There are hundreds of better performing tripods out there, but they will be more expensive. It is fine for the price. It will hold your camera in place and do it safe enough. Are there better fluid heads? Absolutely. Are there better legs? Absolutely. Is there anything out there that does what this tripod does for cheaper? I don't think so.Pros:1. The price. I got this on sale for $140. I've used a lot of tripods and a lot of different brands. You get a lot for that price point.2. The mounting plate seems nice, although finicky. If you use a DJI gimbal, it's nice to be able to use the gimbal plate. I'm all about plates becoming more universal even if I never use this feature.3. The quick release legs are easy to adjust on the fly. The head is overall easy to level with a clear level bubble.4. It's really light weight for it's size and how sturdy it is. And it is really sturdy.5. It has a lot of features you only see on higher end tripods like a bowled head, fluid head (although its not a true fluid head), adjustable pan and tilt, comes with a nice bag, includes tools, etc.6. It gives you a taste of what a real professional tripod might be like, even if it falls short in almost every category compared to real professional tripods.The cons:1. Cheap materials. One of the leg hooks was broken out of the box. My spreader screws were so loose they came undone in shipping and the hardware was flying around in the box. Lots of the plastics seem cheap and brittle throughout the tripod. I cannot imagine how this plastic would stand up in the cold. Typically really nice tripods are mostly metal, this has an overwhelmingly amount of plastic on it.2. Questionable longevity. I probably wouldn't trust this tripod to last long under daily shooting gigs. I bought this tripod knowing it would stay in a studio 70% of the time with light movement. I can't imagine the plastic on this thing will take years of beating like my manfrotto tripods.3. The fluid head adjustments are not very adjustable. They're just friction adjustments and are pretty finicky at best. If you need a high quality pan and tilt movement, just skip this tripod. It will get the job done, but after using a legitimate fluid head you'll notice the differences immediately.4. This kinda goes back to my first point, but the knobs and levers seems like the cheapest of the materials. I'm already concerned about catching them on something and snapping them.Even with my complaints, this is a fantastic CHEAP tripod. If you think you're getting E-image, Manfrotto, Sachtler, bogen quality, you are kidding yourself and need to double check the price and brand on this thing. Don't get me wrong, smallrig has some great accessories and their quality always seems to be good for the price, just remember the price on this is cheap and the tripod reflects that price in many ways, but it also out performs it's asking price in other ways. Just know what you're paying for.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good tripod for small light weight cameras and small light weight setups.
reviews.reviewText: Good tripod for small light weight cameras and small light weight setups. If you have a big camera rig, choose the bigger more expensive tripods.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy tripod. Does the job.
reviews.reviewText: It's a nice tripod. Feels solid and holds my camera rig.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have other small rig products and have always been pleased with them and this one is no different

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than other generic video tripods at this price
reviews.reviewText: I’ve tried other “heavy duty” video tripods at this price range and they all just feel like clones of the same manufacture. This small rig one actually has some solid design elements built in.Lots of convenient features like the Allen tool hidden in the plate, the nice tension leveler built into the head, and just the nice visual design of the legs with the silver accents. So far so good, but I’ll update this review if I have any issues. Oh and the bag it comes in is pretty good too
Tiene muy buena hechura, materiales duraderos, estabilidad y buena calidad de la cabeza. Muy buena relación costo-beneficio.
Surprised that I am getting more accessories made by Smallrig. The tripod is sturdy enough for my A7Riii+2470 lens on the DJI RC 3 Mini gimbal.
These are great! Very well built. They are quite solid, and the extended height is more than sufficient.
Super practico en condiciones controladas, sustituye hasta a los mas caros trípodes..
